title: Sheet Pan Shrimp Fajitas Recipe
description: Shrimp, bell peppers, and jalapeños are tossed with olive oil and fajita seasoning in this quick and easy recipe for sheet pan shrimp fajitas.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Latin American Mexican Main Dishes Fajita Recipes Sheet Pan Shrimp Fajitas 4.7 (89) 73 Reviews 22 Photos Quick and easy sheet pan shrimp fajitas. Serve with tortillas, cilantro, avocado, or any other condiments you like while only using one pan. Submitted by Jen Cooks For Fun Updated on June 12, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 22 22 22 22 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (1 ounce) package fajita seasoning 1 tablespoon olive oil 1 ½ pounds raw shrimp, peeled and deveined 1 red bell pepper, sliced into strips 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced into strips 1 red onion, sliced into strips 1 jalapeno pepper, sliced into rings Directions Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Mix fajita seasoning and olive oil together in a large bowl. Add shrimp; toss to coat. Lay out seasoned shrimp in a single layer on a baking sheet. Add bell peppers, red onion, and jalapeño; mix with shrimp and spread out evenly. Roast in the preheated oven until shrimp are opaque, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer shrimp to a serving plate. Broil pepper mixture until lightly blackened, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to the serving plate with shrimp. I Made It Print 205 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 100 Calories 3g Fat 5g Carbs 14g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 100 % Daily Value * Total Fat 3g 3% Saturated Fat 0g 2% Cholesterol 129mg 43% Sodium 398mg 17% Total Carbohydrate 5g 2% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 1g Protein 14g 28% Vitamin C 22mg 25% Calcium 30mg 2% Iron 2mg 12% Potassium 176mg 4% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Sheet Pan Shrimp Fajitas 01 of 22 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 22 Photo by  Selena Lang 01/29/2023 I don't think I put Enough seasoning In. it was a bit bland But over all very good. The pic isn't the best I didn't fancy it up with garnish And such 03 of 22 Photo by  tcasa 02/08/2022 This recipe was SO good! I used the fajita shrimp for tostadas. To save time I used 1 Tbsp pre-mix taco seasoning but I have made it as written too. Both are fantastic. Served it with an avocado cream sauce! Love it!! 04 of 22 Photo by  Rural Roots 01/01/2022 We really liked it & it was super easy to make. We used yellow onions instead of red & omitted the jalapenos. We will definitely make it again! 05 of 22 Photo by  Elizabeth Currier 12/28/2021 I liked the roasted vegetables. I don't think shrimp lends itself particularly well to fajitas, but that is merely my opinion. Still tasty. 06 of 22 Photo by  Bibi 12/19/2021 My whole family loved this recipe, and we will definitely do it again. I used 2 Tablespoons of olive oil, added 2 Tablespoons of a homemade fajita seasoning, and threw everything in the bowl and stirred. I lined my sheet pan with foil, and I'm very glad I did, because it made clean up a breeze. I did not use the jalapeno, and used equal amounts of red, yellow, and green bell peppers. My shrimp was partially frozen, and 10 minutes was enough. We did like the slight char on the veggies. I served with lime slices and slaw, with chipotle-mayo dressing. We will definitely have this, again! 07 of 22 Photo by  Terry Degrow 12/31/2020 08 of 22 Photo by  Terry Degrow 12/31/2020 09 of 22 Photo by  Cherry A Dunbar 09/23/2020 This was delicious! Followed the recipe except for jalapeno peppers. Instead I used the Mt. Olive Sweet & Hot Peppers. I also used both red and green bell peppers. So yummy! 10 of 22 Photo by  Frances 05/26/2020 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Sheet Pan Chicken Fajitas 443 Ratings Air Fryer Shrimp Fajitas 9 Ratings Easy Chicken and Bell Pepper Fajitas 23 Ratings Vegan Fajitas 159 Ratings Slow Cooker Chicken Fajitas 9 Ratings Air Fryer Steak for Fajitas 2 Ratings Barbeque Pork Fajitas 2 Ratings Tempeh Fajitas 56 Ratings Quick and Easy Shrimp Fajitas 175 Ratings Melt-in-Your-Mouth Beef Fajitas 12 Ratings Vegan Fajitas with Tempeh Air Fryer Turkey Fajitas 2 Ratings 20-Minute Shrimp Fajitas Sheet Pan Dinner 6 Ratings Air Fryer Chicken Fajitas for Two Pollo Fajitas 1,258 Ratings Shrimp Ceviche Baja Style 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Jen Cooks For Fun
instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).;Mix fajita seasoning and olive oil together in a large bowl. Add shrimp; toss to coat.;Lay out seasoned shrimp in a single layer on a baking sheet. Add bell peppers, red onion, and jalapeño; mix with shrimp and spread out evenly.;Roast in the preheated oven until shrimp are opaque, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer shrimp to a serving plate.;Broil pepper mixture until lightly blackened, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to the serving plate with shrimp.
